caption.p: Acclimation temperature × latitudinal extent, two‐way interaction from MCMCglmm model ( p < .004, n = 16 species). Wide‐ranging North American salamander species increase metabolic rate at a higher acclimation temperature, whereas narrow‐ranging species have a sharp drop in metabolic rate. Metabolic rates are weight‐corrected. Shaded areas indicate 95% confidence intervals
